meanings.def: the process of being moved or carried from one place to another
examples: in transit goods damaged in transit
goods in transit between factory and store
Your insurance should cover transit by air, sea or rail.

meanings.def: the act of going through a place on the way to somewhere else
examples: the transit lounge at Vienna airport
a transit visa (= one that allows a person to pass through a country but not to stay there)
The port has become a transit point in the drug trade.
The goods were still in a transit shed on the quay.
Transit passengers are not allowed to leave the airport.
If you are catching a connecting flight please wait in the transit lounge.

meanings.def: the system of buses, trains, etc. that people use to travel from one place to another
examples: The New York transit strike is in its second day.
The city has acquired a light rail transit system.

meanings.def: to pass across or through an area
examples: The ship is currently transiting the Gulf of Mexico.
29 000 vessels transit in and out of the harbour every year.
